reference.title: HTML & CSS Term Glossary
reference.shortdesc: HTML and CSS code is made up of a variety of components. Understanding these terms is crucial to understanding generic containers.

row.entry: An HTML element that gives its contents additional meaning
An HTML element that groups its contents without adding additional meaning
An HTML element that groups a small amount of content within a line of HTML
An HTML element that groups larger amounts of HTML code; often this code would be surrounded by line breaks
The HTML code surrounded in brackets (< and >); can be an opening tag (< >) or a closing tag (</ >)
The opening and closing HTML tags and their contents
CSS that identifies (or "selects") what section of an HTML document to format
CSS that defines what kind of formatting to apply to the selected section
CSS that states the specific result of this formatting
